introCallout.title: Campus safety: Emergency phones
introCallout.text: Keep an eye out for the blue emergency phones around campus. If you press the button, you‚Äôll be connected directly to University Police Dispatch.

outroCallout.title: All done?
outroCallout.text:
Did you spot any of our hidden gators while you explored campus? üêä

(We‚Äôll add photos + exact locations soon!)

tours.name: SFSU Self-Guided Campus Tour ‚Äî Without Housing
tours.description: Academics, student life, dining, and wellness ‚Äî outdoor walking tour.

stops.title: Student Services Building
stops.subtitle: One Stop + key student support
stops.description: The Student Services Building is home to One Stop Student Services, where students receive support with financial aid, billing, transcripts, registration, and enrollment questions. It also houses programs such as the Educational Opportunity Program (EOP), Disability Programs & Resource Center, Counseling & Psychological Services, and other key student support offices. This building centralizes many of the essential services students rely on throughout their academic journey.
stops.address: Student Services Building, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Ethnic Studies & Psychology Building
stops.subtitle: Equity, identity, social justice
stops.description: This building houses the College of Ethnic Studies ‚Äî the first of its kind in the nation ‚Äî along with the Psychology Department. Programs focus on identity, equity, social justice, and human behavior. It represents SFSU‚Äôs historic commitment to activism and inclusion.
stops.address: Ethnic Studies & Psychology Building, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Burk Hall
stops.subtitle: Nursing + classrooms
stops.description: Burk Hall houses academic programs including Nursing and other departments, as well as classroom space. It also connects students to faculty offices and academic resources. Many students take courses here throughout their studies.
stops.address: Burk Hall, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Gymnasium
stops.subtitle: Athletics + Kinesiology
stops.description: The Gymnasium supports Athletics and Kinesiology programs and includes indoor courts, fitness facilities, and training areas. Students use the space for academic classes, recreation, and athletic training. It contributes to campus spirit and student wellness. Right outside, near Don Nasser Family Plaza, is the Gator Spirit Statue of Ally Gator ‚Äî a favorite photo spot and a fun reminder of our Gator pride.
stops.address: Gymnasium, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Thornton Hall
stops.subtitle: Science & Engineering + Planetarium
stops.description: Thornton Hall is home to the College of Science & Engineering. It features lecture halls, laboratories, and the campus Planetarium. Students across STEM majors complete foundational coursework here.
stops.address: Thornton Hall, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Hensill Hall
stops.subtitle: Biology + life sciences
stops.description: Hensill Hall houses Biology and other life science programs. It includes teaching and research laboratories that support hands-on scientific learning. Many STEM and pre-health students take courses here.
stops.address: Hensill Hall, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Science & Engineering Innovation Center
stops.subtitle: Modern labs + project-based learning
stops.description: The Science & Engineering Innovation Center supports engineering and applied sciences programs. These facilities include collaborative labs and modern research spaces designed for project-based learning. They reflect the university‚Äôs focus on innovation and industry preparation.
stops.address: Science & Engineering Innovation Center, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Health & Social Sciences (HSS) Building
stops.subtitle: Wellness + social impact careers
stops.description: The Health & Social Sciences Building houses programs such as Public Health, Social Work, and other community-focused disciplines. It prepares students for careers centered on wellness and social impact. The building encourages interdisciplinary collaboration.
stops.address: Health & Social Sciences Building, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Lam Family College of Business
stops.subtitle: Career readiness + FogCam
stops.description: The Lam Family College of Business houses classrooms, advising offices, and faculty supporting majors such as Finance, Marketing, Accounting, and Management. Students also access career development and internship preparation resources here. The college emphasizes professional readiness. Inside this building is the SFSU FogCam ‚Äî one of the oldest continuously operating webcams in the country ‚Äî so if you look up toward the windows, feel free to wave! You can check it live anytime at: https://fogcam.org/
stops.address: Lam Family College of Business, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Administration Building & Undergraduate Advising Center (UAC)
stops.subtitle: Academic planning + guidance
stops.description: The Administration Building houses university leadership offices and key administrative services. It also contains the Undergraduate Advising Center (UAC), where students receive general education planning and graduation advising support. This building plays a central role in academic guidance and campus operations.
stops.address: Administration Building, San Francisco State University

stops.title: J. Paul Leonard Library & Sutro Library
stops.subtitle: Study, tech lending, archives
stops.description: The J. Paul Leonard Library is a state-of-the-art research and learning center offering study spaces, technology lending, archives, and digital media labs. Within the same facility, the Sutro Library houses a unique collection of rare books and historical materials. Together, they support both modern research and historical scholarship.
stops.address: J. Paul Leonard Library, San Francisco State University

stops.title: The Quad
stops.subtitle: Central campus green
stops.description: The Quad is a central green space used for studying, relaxing, and campus events. Students gather here between classes and during major celebrations. It provides a welcoming outdoor space in the heart of campus.
stops.address: Quad, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Cesar Chavez Student Center
stops.subtitle: Student life hub
stops.description: The Cesar Chavez Student Center is the central hub for student life. It includes dining options, lounges, student organization offices, meeting rooms, and the bookstore. Many campus events and activities take place here throughout the year.
stops.address: Cesar Chavez Student Center, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Creative Arts Building
stops.subtitle: Music + Theatre & Dance
stops.description: The Creative Arts Building houses the School of Music and the School of Theatre & Dance. It includes performance venues such as the McKenna Theatre and rehearsal studios. Students gain hands-on experience in performance and production.
stops.address: Creative Arts Building, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Fine Arts Building
stops.subtitle: Cinema, art, design
stops.description: The Fine Arts Building is home to programs in Cinema, Art, and Design. It includes screening rooms, studio spaces, and digital media labs. Students develop creative skills through hands-on artistic production.
stops.address: Fine Arts Building, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Marcus Hall
stops.subtitle: BECA media production
stops.description: Marcus Hall houses the Department of Broadcast and Electronic Communication Arts (BECA). Students gain hands-on experience in media production, broadcasting, and digital storytelling using professional-grade studios and labs. It‚Äôs a hub for creative and media-focused students.
stops.address: Marcus Hall, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Humanities Building
stops.subtitle: Poetry Center + languages
stops.description: The Humanities Building houses departments within the College of Liberal & Creative Arts, including English, History, and Philosophy. It is also home to the Poetry Center and American Language Institute. The building supports research, writing, and critical thinking across disciplines.
stops.address: Humanities Building, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Monarca Dining Hall (City Eats)
stops.subtitle: All-you-care-to-eat
stops.description: Monarca Dining Hall is one of our primary residential dining facilities, offering all-you-care-to-eat meal options for students living on campus. It features multiple food stations with rotating menus and accommodates various dietary needs. Many first-year students use meal plans here as part of their residential experience.
stops.address: Monarca Dining Hall (City Eats), San Francisco State University

stops.title: West Campus Health & Dining
stops.subtitle: Gator Health Center + Yerba Buena Dining Hall
stops.description: The Gator Health Center provides medical care, lab services, X-rays, and wellness resources to enrolled students. Most services are covered through the student health fee. Yerba Buena Dining Hall in the same building offers flexible meal options and diverse food stations for students in the west campus housing communities.
stops.address: Gator Health Center, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Mashouf Wellness Center
stops.subtitle: Fitness + recreation
stops.description: The Mashouf Wellness Center is a comprehensive recreation and fitness facility featuring a climbing wall, indoor pool, track, weight rooms, and fitness studios. Students can participate in sports, group fitness classes, and wellness programming. It supports both physical health and overall well-being.
stops.address: Mashouf Wellness Center, San Francisco State University

tours.name: SFSU Self-Guided Campus Tour ‚Äî With Housing
tours.description: Includes housing highlights ‚Äî outdoor walking tour.

stops.title: Humanities Building
stops.subtitle: Poetry Center + languages
stops.description: The Humanities Building houses departments within the College of Liberal & Creative Arts, including English, History, and Philosophy. It is also home to the Poetry Center and American Language Institute. The building supports research, writing, and critical thinking across disciplines.
stops.address: Humanities Building, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Monarca Dining Hall (City Eats)
stops.subtitle: All-you-care-to-eat
stops.description: Monarca Dining Hall is one of our primary residential dining facilities, offering all-you-care-to-eat meal options for students living on campus. It features multiple food stations with rotating menus and accommodates various dietary needs. Many first-year students use meal plans here as part of their residential experience.
stops.address: Monarca Dining Hall (City Eats), San Francisco State University

stops.title: West Campus Health & Dining
stops.subtitle: Gator Health Center + Yerba Buena Dining Hall
stops.description: The Gator Health Center provides medical care, lab services, X-rays, and wellness resources to enrolled students. Most services are covered through the student health fee. Yerba Buena Dining Hall in the same building offers flexible meal options and diverse food stations for students in the west campus housing communities.
stops.address: Gator Health Center, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Mashouf Wellness Center
stops.subtitle: Fitness + recreation
stops.description:
The Mashouf Wellness Center is a comprehensive recreation and fitness facility featuring a climbing wall, indoor pool, track, weight rooms, and fitness studios. Students can participate in sports, group fitness classes, and wellness programming. It supports both physical health and overall well-being.

Just beyond this area is University Park North (UPN), an apartment-style housing community primarily for transfer and continuing students. It offers shared kitchens and a more independent living environment while still being within walking distance of campus.
stops.address: Mashouf Wellness Center, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Towers at Centennial Square
stops.subtitle: First-year suite-style housing
stops.description:
Towers at Centennial Square provides suite-style housing primarily for first-year students. Residents share a common living space while maintaining semi-private bedrooms. The Towers help create a strong sense of community during students‚Äô first year on campus.

Near the Towers is University Park South (UPS), another apartment-style housing option for upper-division and transfer students. Like University Park North, it provides a more independent living experience with shared kitchen spaces.
stops.address: Towers at Centennial Square, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Manzanita Square
stops.subtitle: Modern apartments near campus
stops.description: Manzanita Square is a modern apartment-style housing complex located just steps from campus. It includes residential units, retail spaces, and student lounge areas. It primarily serves upper-division and transfer students.
stops.address: Manzanita Square, San Francisco State University

stops.title: Village at Centennial Square
stops.subtitle: Apartment-style student housing
stops.description: Village at Centennial Square is an apartment-style housing community primarily for transfer, international, and continuing students. Units are furnished and offer a more independent living environment. It provides students with a residential experience that blends campus connection with greater autonomy.
stops.address: Village at Centennial Square, San Francisco State University
